gemini-cli-vscode.gemini.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable **Gemini CLI** integration. When enabled, you can:
- Launch Gemini CLI in editor panes
- Send selected text and file paths to Gemini
- Access Gemini commands in context menus

gemini-cli-vscode.codex.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable **Codex CLI (GPT-5)** integration. When enabled, you can:
- Launch Codex CLI in editor panes
- Send selected text and file paths to Codex
- Access Codex commands in context menus

gemini-cli-vscode.claude.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable **Claude Code** integration. When enabled, you can:
- Launch Claude Code in editor panes
- Send selected text and file paths to Claude
- Access Claude commands in context menus

gemini-cli-vscode.qwen.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable **Qwen CLI** integration. When enabled, you can:
- Launch Qwen CLI in editor panes
- Send selected text and file paths to Qwen
- Access Qwen commands in context menus

gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.enabled.title: MAGUS Council Enabled
gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable **MAGUS Council** - a unified interface to interact with multiple AI agents simultaneously.

**Features**:
- Send the same prompt to multiple AIs at once
- Compare responses side-by-side
- Launch all configured CLIs with one command

🔮 *The Council awaits your questions*

gemini-cli-vscode.contextMenu.enabled.description: Show context menu commands for all CLIs
gemini-cli-vscode.contextMenu.enabled.markdownDescription:
Show AI-related commands in context menus (right-click menus).

**Available in**:
- Editor context menu
- Explorer context menu
- Editor tab context menu

💡 **Tip**: You can fine-tune which commands appear in the Advanced settings

gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable the **Save to History** feature for saving terminal and editor selections to `.history-memo` folder.

**Features**:
- Save terminal conversations with one click
- Preserve important code snippets and discussions
- Automatically organize by date
- Shows status bar button when terminal is active

💾 **Keep your AI conversations for future reference**

gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.defaultAg.description: Default agents to select in MAGUS Council
gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.defaultAg.markdownDescription:
Choose which AI agents are selected by default when opening MAGUS Council.

**Available agents**:
- `gemini` - Google's Gemini AI
- `codex` - OpenAI Codex (GPT-5)
- `claude` - Anthropic's Claude
- `qwen` - Alibaba's Qwen

🎯 Select your preferred AI team

gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.launch.cl.title: Launch CLIs
gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.launch.cl.description: CLIs to launch with 'Launch All CLIs' command (order matters)
gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.launch.cl.markdownDescription:
Configure which **CLIs** to launch and their order when using **Launch All CLIs** command.

**Tips**:
- Order determines terminal arrangement (left to right)
- Only enabled CLIs will actually launch
- Perfect for setting up your AI workspace quickly

🚀 Launch your AI fleet with one click

gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.showStat.description: Show 'Save to History' button in status bar when terminal is active
gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.showStat.markdownDescription:
Show **Save to History** button in the status bar when a terminal is active.

**Features**:
- Quick access to save terminal conversations
- Appears only when terminal is focused
- Saves to `.history-memo` folder

💾 One-click conversation backup

gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.includeT.description: Include terminal name in history entries
gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.includeT.markdownDescription:
Include the terminal name (e.g., 'Gemini CLI', 'Codex CLI') in saved history entries.

**Benefits**:
- Track which AI provided each response
- Easier to search through history
- Better context when reviewing past conversations

🏷️ Adds source attribution to saved content

gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.useLocal.description: Use local timezone for history file dates
gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.useLocal.markdownDescription:
Use local timezone instead of UTC for history file dates and timestamps.

**Benefits**:
- Files are dated according to your local time
- Late-night work stays in the correct day
- More intuitive file organization
- Timestamps show your actual local time

üïê **Example**: Work at 1 AM stays in previous day's file with boundary at 2 AM

gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.dayBound.patternErrorMessage: Time must be in HH:MM format (e.g., 02:00)
gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.dayBound.description: Day boundary time for history files
gemini-cli-vscode.saveToHistory.dayBound.markdownDescription:
Time when a new day starts for history files (HH:MM format).

**Use cases**:
- `00:00` - Standard midnight boundary
- `02:00` - For night shift workers (2 AM boundary)
- `05:00` - For early birds (5 AM boundary)
- `06:00` - For 6-to-6 day cycles

üìÖ **Work before this time goes to previous day's file**

üí° **Tip**: Set to 2-6 AM if you often work late nights

gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.composer..markdownDescription:
Automatically save prompts sent from **MAGUS Council Composer** to `.history-memo/YYYY-MM-DD.md` files.

**What gets saved**:
- Prompts sent via MAGUS Council Composer interface
- Timestamp and target AI agents
- Context files if included

**Note**: Direct terminal conversations are NOT included. Use the 'Save to History' button for terminal sessions.

📝 Files are organized by date for easy navigation

gemini-cli-vscode.contextMenu.showSendTe.description: Show 'Send Selected Text' commands in context menus
gemini-cli-vscode.contextMenu.showSendTe.markdownDescription:
Show **Send Selected Text** commands in context menus.

**When enabled**:
- Right-click selected text to send it to any active AI terminal
- Works with code, comments, or any text selection

✍️ Quick way to ask AI about selected code

gemini-cli-vscode.contextMenu.showSendFi.description: Show 'Send File Path' and 'Send Open File Path' commands in context menus
gemini-cli-vscode.contextMenu.showSendFi.markdownDescription:
Show **Send File Path** commands in context menus.

**Commands**:
- `Send File Path` - Send a specific file path to AI
- `Send Open File Path` - Send all open file paths at once

📁 Perfect for asking AI to analyze multiple files

gemini-cli-vscode.gemini.showInContextMe.description: Show Gemini CLI commands in context menus
gemini-cli-vscode.gemini.showInContextMe.markdownDescription:
Show Gemini-specific commands in right-click context menus.

⚠️ **Note**: Requires `contextMenu.enabled` to be true

🖉 Customize your context menu per AI

gemini-cli-vscode.codex.showInContextMen.description: Show Codex CLI commands in context menus
gemini-cli-vscode.codex.showInContextMen.markdownDescription:
Show Codex-specific commands in right-click context menus.

⚠️ **Note**: Requires `contextMenu.enabled` to be true

🖉 Customize your context menu per AI

gemini-cli-vscode.claude.showInContextMe.description: Show Claude Code commands in context menus
gemini-cli-vscode.claude.showInContextMe.markdownDescription:
Show Claude-specific commands in right-click context menus.

🖉 Customize your context menu per AI

gemini-cli-vscode.qwen.showInContextMenu.description: Show Qwen commands in context menus
gemini-cli-vscode.qwen.showInContextMenu.markdownDescription:
Show Qwen-specific commands in right-click context menus.

gemini-cli-vscode.terminal.disableFlowCo.description: Disable XON/XOFF flow control (stty -ixon) to prevent Ctrl+S from freezing output
gemini-cli-vscode.terminal.disableFlowCo.markdownDescription:
Disable terminal flow control to prevent `Ctrl+S` from freezing the output.

**Why this matters**:
- `Ctrl+S` normally pauses terminal output (XON/XOFF)
- This can make the terminal appear frozen
- Disabling allows `Ctrl+S` to work as Save in VS Code

⚙️ Runs `stty -ixon` automatically in each terminal

gemini-cli-vscode.terminal.groupingBehav.description: Terminal grouping behavior when launching CLIs from editor buttons
gemini-cli-vscode.terminal.groupingBehav.markdownDescription:
How to group terminals when launching CLIs from **editor buttons**.

**Options**:
- `same`: Open in the same editor group (recommended for multiple CLIs)
- `new`: Open in a new editor group (VS Code default)

💡 **Note**: This affects editor button commands. Context menu commands still allow explicit choice.
enumDescriptions: Open terminals in the same editor group
Open terminals in new editor groups

gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.composer..description: Initial delay before sending prompt to each AI (milliseconds)
gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.composer..markdownDescription:
Delay before sending prompts to AI terminals (in milliseconds).

**When to adjust**:
- Increase if terminals need more time to initialize
- Decrease for faster systems
- Set to 0 for instant sending (may cause issues)

⏱️ Default: 100ms

gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.composer..description: Delay before sending Enter to Claude Code after prompt (milliseconds)
gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.composer..markdownDescription:
⚠️ **Advanced Setting**

Delay before pressing Enter after pasting prompt to Claude (milliseconds).

**When to adjust**:
- Increase if Claude doesn't receive the full prompt
- Decrease for faster response

⏱️ Default: 150ms

gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.composer..description: Delay before sending Enter to Gemini CLI after prompt (milliseconds)
gemini-cli-vscode.magusCouncil.composer..markdownDescription:
⚠️ **Advanced Setting**

Delay before pressing Enter after pasting prompt to Gemini (milliseconds).

**When to adjust**:
- Increase if Gemini doesn't receive the full prompt
- Decrease for faster response
- Gemini typically needs more time than other CLIs

⏱️ Default: 600ms

gemini-cli-vscode.gemini.command.markdownDescription:
Custom command to launch Gemini CLI.

**Examples**:
- `gemini` (default)
- `/usr/local/bin/gemini`
- `docker run gemini-cli`
- Custom wrapper script

🔧 Change only if using non-standard installation

gemini-cli-vscode.gemini.args.markdownDescription:
Additional command-line arguments for Gemini CLI.

**Example arguments**:
- `["--model", "gemini-pro"]`
- `["--temperature", "0.7"]`
- `["--max-tokens", "2000"]`

📦 Arguments are passed directly to the CLI

Additional command-line arguments for Qwen CLI.

gemini-cli-vscode.migration.v3.notified.description: Whether v0.3.0 migration notification has been shown
gemini-cli-vscode.migration.v3.notified.markdownDescription:
Internal flag to track if the v0.3.0 command migration notification has been shown.

⚠️ **Advanced**: Only change this if you want to reset the notification.

gemini-cli-vscode.diagnostics.performanc.markdownDescription:
📊 Enable performance metrics logging to track extension and terminal operation times.

**When enabled**:
- Logs timing for extension activation
- Tracks terminal creation time
- Measures text send operations

⚠️ **Advanced**: May impact performance slightly when enabled.

gemini-cli-vscode.templates.sources.shar.markdownDescription: Enable reading templates from `.magus-templates/shared` (or a custom path).

gemini-cli-vscode.templates.sources.shar.description: Path to shared templates directory (relative or absolute)
gemini-cli-vscode.templates.sources.shar.markdownDescription: Directory path for shared templates. **Relative paths** are resolved against the workspace root. **Absolute paths** are used as-is.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
scripts.test:unit:focus-ext: npm run compile && vscode-test --config .vscode-test-unit.mjs --files out/test/unit/{extension,terminalManager}.test.js --grep "Extension Activation|Terminal Creation Commands|Save to History Functionality|Send Open Files|Terminal Cleanup|Paste and Enter" --reporter dot
scripts.test:unit:send-open-files: npm run compile && vscode-test --config .vscode-test-unit.mjs --files out/test/unit/extension.test.js --grep "Send Open Files" --reporter dot
scripts.test:unit:save-history: npm run compile && vscode-test --config .vscode-test-unit.mjs --files out/test/unit/extension.test.js --grep "Save to History Functionality" --reporter dot
